intro: Phyllantherum sessile, commonly known as the sessile phyllantherum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to yellowish flowers. It produces small, dry fruits that contain minute seeds. Phyllantherum sessile is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
